ZCL_ConfigureReportingReq_t Struct Reference

Type describing payload element of configure report request command. More...

#include <zcl.h>

Data Fields

uint8_t direction
ZCL_AttributeId_t attributeId
union {
   struct {
      uint8_t   attributeType
      ZCL_ReportTime_t   minReportingInterval
      ZCL_ReportTime_t   maxReportingInterval
      uint8_t   reportableChange [1]
   } 
   ZCL_ReportTime_t   timeoutPeriod
}; 

Detailed Description

Type describing payload element of configure report request command.

This type can be used to add one reporting record to the "configure report" request payload.

Definition at line 887 of file zcl.h.

Field Documentation

uint8_t ZCL_ConfigureReportingReq_t::direction

The direction field specifies whether values of the attribute are be reported (0x00), or whether reports of the attribute are to be received (0x01).

Definition at line 891 of file zcl.h.

ZCL_AttributeId_t ZCL_ConfigureReportingReq_t::attributeId

If the direction field is 0x00, this field contains the identifier of the attribute to be reported. If, instead, the direction field is 0x01, the device shall expect reports of values of this attribute.

Definition at line 895 of file zcl.h.

uint8_t ZCL_ConfigureReportingReq_t::attributeType

The attribute data type field contains the data type of the attribute that is to be reported.

Definition at line 902 of file zcl.h.

ZCL_ReportTime_t ZCL_ConfigureReportingReq_t::minReportingInterval

The minimum reporting interval field is 16 bits in length and shall contain the minimum interval, in seconds, between issuing reports of the specified attribute.

Definition at line 905 of file zcl.h.

ZCL_ReportTime_t ZCL_ConfigureReportingReq_t::maxReportingInterval

The maximum reporting interval field is 16 bits in length and shall contain the maximum interval, in seconds, between issuing reports of the specified attribute.

Definition at line 909 of file zcl.h.

uint8_t ZCL_ConfigureReportingReq_t::reportableChange[1]

The reportable change field shall contain the minimum change to the attribute that will result in a report being issued. This field is of variable length. For attributes with 'analog' data type the field has the same data type as the attribute.

Definition at line 914 of file zcl.h.

ZCL_ReportTime_t ZCL_ConfigureReportingReq_t::timeoutPeriod

The timeout period field is 16 bits in length and shall contain the maximum expected time, in seconds, between received reports for the attribute specified in the attribute ID field. If more time than this elapses between reports, this may be an indication that there is a problem with reporting. If this value is set to 0x0000, reports of the attribute are not subject to timeout.

Definition at line 921 of file zcl.h.
